Hello, little engineers! Today, we’re going to help Khaled who
uses a wheelchair get down a ramp safely and nicely. But first—we need to find the best ramp shape and the best material to build it with.

You have three different ramp shapes:
Spiral Ramp Steep Ramp Straight Ramp Let’s Try the Ramps!
1 . Use the same cardboard to make each ramp.
2 . Roll a toy ball down the ramp. Watch what happens!
Now think about these questions: • Did the ball go fast or slow?
• Did it roll nicely or bounce around?
• Did it stay safe and not fall off? Try all the ramps.
Which one works best? Pick your favourite!
Now let’s try three different materials to make the ramp and test how the wheelchair moves:
• Swimming noodles. • Cardboard.
• Aluminium foil.
Cardboard. Swimming noodles. Aluminium foil. We’ll use each material to build our ramp and roll the ball again.
Ask yourself: • Which one helped the wheelchair roll the smoothest?

Hey flriends
Let's Wrap Up What We have Learned About Ramps! Ramps are simple machines that help us move things up and down more easily.
They let us roll or push instead of lifting heavy things. We use ramps in many places like playgrounds, roads, and buildings to make moving easier and safer.
A spiral ramp is just a ramp that goes around in a circle — fun and helpful too. It makes it easier to go up slowly

Now it’s time to make it real. Your teacher will give you a cardboard grid to use as your building space.
What to do: Step 1: Draw a number line from 1–12.
Step 2: Assign each playground item a number.
Step 3: Count how many of each item you need. Step 4: Decide the order to build them.
